job.title: Software Engineer
job.description: Software EngineerFreeWill is an award-winning, social-good startup that has raised more than $2 billion for high impact nonprofits since we were founded in 2017. Weâve been featured in the New York Times, Forbes, Oprahâs magazine, and have even been named to Town & Countryâs âTop 50 Philanthropistsâ list.All of this is because weâve figured out how to make some powerful (but complicated!) ways to donate much easier and more accessible. Our products make things easier for the donors who want to change the world and for nonprofits doing heroic work around the planet.In the last 3 years, weâve grown from 5 people to 95+ (all smart, tenacious, and kind), and continue to grow quickly. Weâd love to have you be a part of this adventure.Job descriptionWe are looking for an ambitious software engineer who wants to make impact at a mission-driven company.This role can be remote or based out of New York City. Competitive comp & equity. Flexible start date. Unfortunately, we canât sponsor H1Bs at this time.Roles & ResponsibilitiesWork on a modern stack, including React, Node.js, TypeScript, PostgreSQL, and AWSOwn the design and development of new features for FreeWill web applicationsLearn and grow in a collaborative environment, sharing knowledge through code reviews, pair programming, 1-1 conversations, and broader team trainingsInteract closely with a diverse team across legal, growth, design, and productContribute ideas to improve our product, technology, and team practicesGain knowledge of end-of-life planning and nonprofit fundraising â what currently is working, what is not, and what tech can do to help fix itTechnical Skills2+ years professional experienceBachelorâs degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent training, fellowship, or work experienceFamiliarity with databases, API design, automated testing, debugging, and web front endsOther Important TraitsIntense curiosityScrappiness and gritFocus on continuous learningComfort with ambiguityBenefitsIn addition to helping raise $1T for high impact nonprofits and a kind and joyful work environment, full time employees at FreeWill are eligible for the following benefits:Work from home$120 monthly stipend to outfit your home office or cover utility billsUnlimited PTOStaff holidays and FreeDays (periodic one day office closures to rest and refresh)Company stock options401kMedical/Dental/Vision (some single coverage medical plans are 100% employer paid, subsidized rates for spousal, parent-child, and family coverage)Free One Medical membershipPaid parental leaveBook policy: Weâll cover any reasonably priced books that will make you better at your job (i.e how to excel in sales) or improve the FreeWill community (i.e. books on anti-racism).FreeWill is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We are committed to finding talent that is not determined on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.We are a remote-first company thatâs able to hire in 47 states and D.C. Unfortunately, we are unable to hire in Colorado, Alabama, or Louisiana at this time. We also canât sponsor working visas, so all applicants will need to have work authorization in the US.Excited about our mission? Success in serving nonprofit partners requires our dedication to building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive team. We encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds and all walks of life to apply. We canât wait to learn with and from you.
